channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The return-to-office battle is jeopardizing the new American Dream: staying at home
item.description: The COVID-19 pandemic did spur more Americans to stay home, but also accelerated ongoing trends.

item.title: Canadian politician claims Trump admin's '51st state' rhetoric is an 'act of war'
item.description: A liberal Canadian member of Parliament said the Trump administration's tariffs and "51st state" rhetoric is an "act of war."

item.title: A bubble tea chain and a toy doll are the latest casualties of Beijing and Hanoi’s competing claims over the South China Sea
item.description: Vietnamese flooded Chagee with negative comments after the bubble tea chain's app used a map that endorsed Beijing's expansive territorial claims.

item.title: Trump signs executive order aims to streamline federal procurement under GSA
item.description: President Trump has signed an executive order that centralizes federal government procurement under the General Services Administration.

item.title: Trump gives New York 30 more days to end Manhattan congestion toll as state officials refuse to comply
item.description: The Trump administration has pushed back a Friday deadline for New York to end its new $9 congestion toll on most drivers entering Manhattan.

item.title: Pentagon set to award US Air Force's next-generation fighter jet contract, sources say
item.description: Despite earlier concerns about shifting priorities and budget constraints, the Pentagon is slated to soon announce its decision on a next-generation f...

item.title: Greene calls for yanking FDA approval of COVID-19 vaccines: 'Causing permanent harm and deaths'
item.description: Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene calls for yanking FDA approval of COVID-19 vaccines, says that "COVID-19 vaccines are causing permanent harm and deaths."

item.title: Elaine Chao on the Trump Administration: ‘What you all want is certainty and you’re not going to get it’
item.description: Also: Tesla bulls turn on Elon, Europe’s busiest airport was closed by a huge fire.

item.title: Husband of former 'Squad' Rep. Cori Bush charged with wire fraud linked to COVID relief funds: DOJ
item.description: The husband of former U.S. Rep. Cori Bush was charged with wire fraud after allegedly accepting pandemic-era funds, federal prosecutors said.

item.title: Leftist Nonprofit Tries To Smear Election Integrity Efforts With ‘Hocus-Pocus’ Study
item.description: The CEO of a leftist group claims conservatives funded 'election deniers and anti-voting rights organizations,' citing a questionable study.

item.title: Colleges are fleeing from The PhD Project, which helps Black and Latino students get business degrees, as it’s attacked by Trump anti-DEI activists
item.description: The U.S. Education Department last week said it was investigating dozens of universities for alleged racial discrimination, citing ties to the nonprof...

item.title: Bernie Sanders, AOC, take aim at Trump and Musk, as well as Democrats, at western rallies
item.description: Bernie Sanders and AOC headline a rally in Tempe, Arizona as part of a three-day, five-city swing through Western states where they took aim at Presid...

item.title: The Biden Education Department Burned $100M On ‘Anti-Racist’ Social Workers And DEI For K-12 Schools
item.description: The Biden administration’s Department of Education threw away over $100 million on university grant funding to train K-12 social workers in diversity,...

item.title: New York’s Highest Court Shoots Down Democrats’ Efforts To Let Noncitizens Vote
item.description: New York’s highest court struck down New York City’s noncitizen voting law as unconstitutional on Thursday. The New York State Court of Appeals ruled ...

item.title: Gang tattoos and hand signs: How ICE identified Venezuelan gang members to deport as terrorists
item.description: Immigration officers looked at Jerce Reyes Barrios and saw tattoos with a crown and the word "Dios" -- both of which are considered by law enforcement...

item.description: When the media omit the facts that matter most, it's clear that they are more interested in undermining the Trump administration than informing the pu...

item.title: Trump signs executive order expanding critical mineral extraction
item.description: President Trump signed an executive order Thursday aimed at boosting the ability of the United States to extract critical minerals while saying he's s...

item.title: A Tale of Two Deportation Cases
item.description: In the case of the Venezuelans, the DOJ is resisting the kind of meticulous review that it provided in Mahmoud Khalil’s case.

item.title: New York City's noncitizen voting law ruled illegal by top state court
item.description: New York City's attempt to allow noncitizens to cast ballots in local elections violates the state constitution, the state's top court ruled Thursday.

item.description: The order directs McMahon to take 'all necessary steps to facilitate the closure of the Department of Education and return education authority to the ...

item.title: Thoughts on Federal Arts Money After President Autopen
item.description: And why wallop libraries? They teach people to think for themselves.

item.title: Fix VOA, Don’t Kill It
item.description: The goal should be to reinvigorate American public diplomacy.

item.title: Trump administration announces plans to expand oil and gas drilling in Alaska
item.description: The Trump administration said Thursday it will reopen most of Alaska's National Petroleum Reserve and will enable a liquid natural gas pipeline and mi...

item.title: Pro-Union Republicans Don’t Get Trump’s Real Appeal
item.description: Democrats have lost the working class in large part because they put unions over workers. Republicans shouldn’t make the same mistake.

item.title: The Most Important China Book of the Decade
item.description: Tom Cotton brings to a mass audience a critical message about Beijing’s threats.

item.title: Book Review: Buffett’s Early Investments
item.description: This book digs into Buffett’s pre-Berkshire investments. The result is a fresh look into the origins of his investment approach.

item.title: The Alternative View: 401(k) Plans Are Better off Without Private Investments
item.description: The debate over the inclusion of private investments in 401(k) plans is a hot topic. Are DC plans better off without them?

item.title: Decades in a Week: Germany’s Fiscal Breakthrough and Its Global Impact
item.description: Does Germany's massive fiscal package mark the beginning of a lasting regime change or just another chapter in market volatility?

item.title: 6 Reasons to Avoid Hedge Funds
item.description: Financial success depends on disciplined saving and investing, not fancy investment products and high returns.
